data.title: The Elephant’s Journey by Jose Saramago
data.meta_description: Jose Saramago died in June at the age of 87. He was awarded the Nobel prize in 1998, was a member of the Portuguese Communist party and was involved in several fierce controversies. In 1992, his The
data.text:
Jose Saramago died in June at the age of 87. He was awarded the Nobel prize in 1998, was a member of the Portuguese Communist party and was involved in several fierce controversies. In 1992, his The Gospel According to Jesus Christ offended Catholics and was banned by the Portuguese government from competing for a European literary prize, causing him to leave Portugal and settle in the Canaries. Ten years later, after visiting Palestine during the second intifada, his statement comparing Ramallah to Auschwitz and Buchenwald, a subsequent article and a speech in which he elaborated his view that “the Jews are unworthy of any more sympathy for their sufferings during the second world war” were condemned as anti-semitic, a charge he denied.

In view
